page.title: 15 Weaverthorpe 1945-1985
page.content: At the end of the war{evacuees}from {Hull}went home, apart from a few who still live here, and the{soldiers returned from N. Africa and Europe. The{council estate}was built, children over 11 moved to Driffield to {new}large{schools. Mains water}and {drainage,}aided by{electricity, brought great changes to{home life:- flush toilets, now taken for granted, as are television, video recorders, computers, refridgerators, freezers, washing machines etc. In the sixties the{factory}was built, in 1971{decimal coinage}was brought in and in 1974 we were moved from the north edge of the{East Riding of Yorkshire to the southern border of {North Yorkshire. Now most people work out of the village,using{private transport.
